value.name: Michael John Cowie's cowardly attack on a young woman will result in long jail term
value.description: A 38-year-old ice affected man who stabbed a young woman in the face with scissors on a Sunday afternoon will inevitably do a lengthy prison term for the crime, a Supreme Court Judge said.

Sandwich shop operator accused in U.S. Capitol mob files appeal over remaining jailed
value.description: George Tanios, the Morgantown sandwich shop operator accused in the pepper-spraying of U.S. Capitol police on Jan. 6, is appealing a judge’s decision to keep him in jai Lawyers for Tanios filed the notice of appeal Wednesday.

value.name: Ridgely man sentenced on child sex abuse, rape charges
value.description: A Ridgely man was found guilty of two counts of second-degree rape and child sex abuse May 18 in Caroline County Circuit Court.

value.name: Driver accused of blocking speed camera for two hours will not face trial
value.description: A Scunthorpe van driver who was accused of blocking a mobile speed camera for two hours will not face a trial. Michael John Masterson was charged after he was accused of parking in front of the camera and opening his van doors to obscure its view of passing motorists.

value.name: Truckie who blew more than 3 times limit after highway crash faces court
value.description: A truck driver involved in a crash on the Bruce Highway near Gympie blew more than three times the limit when tested at the scene, Gympie Magistrates Court heard on Thursday.

value.name: ROUGH CUTS | A friend’s thought on the WPS issue
value.description: FOR THE past few days we have been writing about our personal views how and why the issue on the Philippines’ territorial dispute with China on the South China Sea — or call it West Philippine Sea (WPS) as that body of water is in the west of our country — has happened and has persisted until today.

value.name: Two of Officer Brian Sicknick’s Accused Assailants Must Stay in Jail Pending Trial in Spray Case
value.description: The two men charged with assaulting the late U.S. Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick and other authorities with chemical spray must remain in jail pending trial, a federal judge ruled on Tuesday.
